title: JSON formatting schema for the VSCode Liquid extension

specBasicTypes.description:
The valueof type of this object. This refers to what the object holds. This is used to validate whether the value can be iterated.

 Please note that the type property here is completely different from type property found in filter arguments.

oneOf.description: Representative of an object which has property values. When declaring an "object" type it is expect it has "property" references.
Representative of a number value, eg: 100
Representative of a boolean value, eg: "true" or "false"
Representative of a boolean value, eg: "true" or "false"
Representative of an array value. Such a type is allowed to be iterated.

name.description: The name of the property the object provides.

specObjects.description: List of object specifications available to the defined engines variation

deprecated.description: Whether this object is deprecated of not, defaults to "false" and can be omitted unless otherwise required.

filters.description: Whether or not this object value can be use within filters. In some cases, object tags or variable based objects do not accept filters. Some objects in a Variation like Shopify hold "constanant" variable state, if an object is defined as such it unlikely it can be used or contain filters. All objects are assumed to be accept and be used within filters, so this field defaults to "true" and can be omitted unless otherwise required.

reference.description: URL reference to online documentation explaining this object.

trims.description: Whether or not this object value can use whitespace dash trim delimiters. Some objects in a Variation like Shopify hold "constanant" variable state, if an object is defined as such it unlikely filters are allowed.

global.description: Whether or not this object is a global value. Global values are accessible from any template or file. All objects are assumed to no global scope, so this field defaults to "false" and can be omitted unless otherwise required.

const.description:
Whether or not this object is a content or constanant value. In some cases, object tags are variable based objects used to output content of templates files and in the Shopify Variation this includes scripts and stylesheets. Some objects in a variations like Shopify hold a "constanant" variable state. If an object is defined as such then its unlikely filters or trims are allowed and thus when a object has a const "true" value assigned, then both "trim" and "filters" are assumed to "false" and if otherwise not, you will need to explicity set them to "true" when this field is true.

and All objects are assumed to not be a "const" values, so this field defaults to "false" and can be omitted unless otherwise required.

scope.description: Some objects are accessible within tag based scope. For example, the "{{ form }}" object available in the Shopify Liquid variation is a scope based tag and must be used within a "{% form %}" tag. When an object is scope based include the name of tag scope in this field.

properties.description: List of properties pertaining to the object. When the property the property asserts a type "object" you will nest its properties in a recursive manner.

unknownAttributes.description: Validates the attributes used on tags
unknownAttributes.markdownDescription:
Validates the attributes used on tags.

For example:

	<main type="text">
</main>

 Where the `type` is a valid attribute but only on certain tags (like the `<input>` tag) and has no business being used on a semantic `<main>` tag.

attributeValues.description: Validates the values of tag attributes
attributeValues.markdownDescription:
Validates the values of tag attributes.

For example:

	<input type="foo">
 Where the `type` attribute does not accept a value equal to `foo` and only accepts certain values, like `text` or `checkbox` etc etc.

syntacticHTMLPairs.description: Validates the start and end tag existence of HTML pairs
syntacticHTMLPairs.markdownDescription:
Validates the start and end tag existence of HTML pairs.

For example:

	<main>
		<div>
	</main>

 Where the `<div>` tag is missing its closing (end) tag.

oneOf.description: Enforces correct tag names are used, only tags that are valid within the official HTML specification are valid or defined custom data tags.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Enforces correct tag names are used, only tags that are valid within the official HTML specification are valid or defined custom data tags. For example: Where the `divv` tag name is invalid.

oneOf.description: Disabled validation of HTML tag names
markdownEnumDescriptions: Disabled validation of HTML tag names. For example: Where the `divv` tag is perfectly fine.

outputTagAttributes.description: Allows Liquid output tags to be used in HTML tag attributes.
outputTagAttributes.markdownDescription:
Allows Liquid output tags to be used in HTML tag attributes.

For example:

	<div class="foo" {{ some_value }}>

outputTagValues.description: Allows Liquid output tags to be used in HTML tag attribute values (within quotations).
outputTagValues.markdownDescription:
Allows Liquid output tags to be used in HTML tag attribute values (within quotations).

For example:

	<div id="{{ foo }}" class="{{ value }}">

controlTagsValues.description: Allows Liquid control type tags to be used in HTML tag attribute values (within quotations).
controlTagsValues.markdownDescription:
Allows Liquid output tags to be used in HTML tag attribute values (within quotations).

For example:

	<div class="foo {% if x %}bar{% endif %}">

controlTagAttributes.description: Allows Liquid control type tags to be used in HTML tag attributes.
controlTagAttributes.markdownDescription:
Allows Liquid control type tags to be used in HTML tag attributes.

For example:

	<div {% if true %} class="x" {% endif %}>

iterationAttributes.description: Allows Liquid iteration type tags to be used in HTML tag attributes (not reccomended).
iterationAttributes.markdownDescription:
Allows Liquid iteration type tags to be used in HTML tag attributes (not reccomended).

For example:

	<div {% for i in items %} data-{{ i }}="foo" {% endfor %}>

---

**NOTE:**

Leave this options set to `false` and avoid infusing for loops within HTML tag attributes.

iterationValues.description: Allows Liquid iteration type tags to be used in HTML tag values (not reccomended).
iterationValues.markdownDescription:
Allows Liquid iteration type tags to be used in HTML tag attributes values between quotes (not reccomended).

For example:

	<div class={% for i in items %}{{ i }}{% endfor %}">

---

**NOTE:**

Leave this options set to `false` and avoid infusing for loops within HTML tag attributes values.
.

quotationCharacters.description: Validates the type of quotation characters used for tag values

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Enforces double quotation characters (reccomended).

For example:

	<div id="foo">

---

**NOTE:**

The vast majoirty of HTML markup attribute values use double quotes, so don't be a hero. Leave this option set to `double` for sake of the majority.

Enforced single quotation characters (not-reccomended).

For example:

	<div id='foo'>

---

**NOTE:**

Don't do this. Do you want to get bullied? Using single quotations for HTML attribute values is how you get bullied.

syntacticLiquidPairs.description: Validates the start and end tag existence of Liquid and HTML tag pairs.
syntacticLiquidPairs.markdownDescription: Validates the start and end tag existence of Liquid and HTML tag pairs.

tagHTMLPlacement.title: Tag Placement
tagHTMLPlacement.description: Validates the placement position of tags that should be nested

tagLiquidPlacement.description: Validates the hierarchical placements of tags, ie: li tags must be contained in ul tags
tagLiquidPlacement.markdownDescription:
Validates the hierarchical placements of tags, ie: `li` tags must be contained in `ul` tags. For example:
      • Where the `
        ` is incorrectly placed.

enable.description: Whether to allow or disallow extraneous whitespace.

limit.description: The maximum number of whitespace that can be preserved

extraneousWhitespace.description: Allows extraneous whitespace within Liquid tags.
extraneousWhitespace.markdownDescription:
Allows extraneous whitespace within Liquid tags.

For example:

	{{ tag   }}

---

**NOTE:**

This is auto-fixable ruleset, so extraneous whitespace that is detected will automatically stripped if you are formatting on save.

iterationArrayType.description: Validates whether a provided iteration array is of an array type.

unknownFilter.description: Validates whether a provided tag filter is known or unknown.

noNestedForLoops.description: Validates whether for loops can nest for loops

files.description: List of file extension to apply formatting rules. Helpful when you want the formatter to handle ".js.liquid" or ".scss.liquid" files

tags.description: Format options or rules applied to a custom set of defined tags

oneOf.description: This option will query select all Liquid tags according to the defined "tag" name
This option will query select all HTML tags by according to the defined "tag" name

tag.title: Tag name
tag.description: The name of the HTML or Liquid tag. Do not include delimeters or use expression syntax, accepts only a string value

attr.title: Tag attribute
attr.description: Define the tag by its attribute value. The extension will query select the defined tag and matching attribute property or value

ignore.title: Ignore Tag
ignore.description: Should this tag be skipped and ignored from formatting.

items.description: Glob pattern to files and/or directories to be ignored by the formatter

engine.title: Liquid Engine
engine.description: The Liquid variation this project is using. Defaults to "Standard" and defines the type of completion references and hover descriptions intellisense uses.

validate.title: Validations
validate.description: Diagnostic/Linting validation to execute on Liquid syntax.

format.title: Prettify Beautification
format.description: Formatting rules and options passed to Prettify

specs.title: Specifications
specs.description: Extends the specification data references so the parser can understand custom tags and the Language Server can provide features to the tags.

html.description: Custom set of HTML tags, attributes or values. Liquify understands and adopts an almost indentical schema to vscode-custom-data and will merge "html.customData" contributes located in worskpace settings.

liquid.description: Custom set of Liquid tags, objects or filters. Extends the liquid specifications. Refer to the Liquid Specifications documentation to learn more about the specs and how to extends them.
